ol.title: To edit a virtual host domain:
ol.li: On the Control Panel home page, under Domain Management, click Domain List. The Domains window appears.
In the Actions column, click properties for the domain you want to edit. The Properties window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain Setup, click Edit. The Edit Domain Setup window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain, you can select to disable or enable this domain's alias.
Next to IP Address, select the IP address for the domain.

Next to Web Services, select the web services you want to enable. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, select the number of end users you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Email Addresses, select the number of email addresses you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Website Logs, select the Website log options you want.
Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want. If you want catchall mail delivered to a specific address, select Deliver mail to and type that address in the Deliver mail to field.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Click Save. A message appears informing you that the domain has been changed.
